TopicTitle: Omg what happened to my orbit?

Articles.Content:
I HAD a mothership in a circular retrograde ( **** me ) parking orbit a few Mm outside Laythe's. I started up the game hoping to make the hop over to Laythe to discover the ship shooting back out to almost double Pol's distance...w...t...f...happened? My fuel is untouched. I have been playing with a detached probe landing on another moon since so an SoI change couldn't have affected it. This concerns me. I think im getting bugged out here because I swear I entered Jool's system prograde. I cant remember exactly, but that was a wtf moment for me too. And this tells me that it all could've been from a glitch. Its not all bad.. I guess. Im going to try and correct the orbit at periapsis and see if I can enter the system in the right direction this time. This ever happen to anyone else?

Edited August 16, 2013 by Motokid600

Theres nothing really to see. Just magically went from a circular orbit to a very eccentric one. All is well it was just a strange anomaly. I made it to Laythe orbit pretty easily despite being hurled out of the system. Gotta love atmospheres.
if you warped through the SoI change, it might have confused the orbit calculations.
